title: Bank Makramah’s loss increases to Rs5.3bn in 2023
summary: Bank Makramah Limited BML formerly known as Summit Bank Limited posted losses to the tune of Rs5.33 billion in 2023 up over 67 from the lossaftertax of Rs3.19 billion in 2022. BMLs other income also improved significantly with a 714 increase YoY.

title: ‘Summit Bank’ redefines itself to ‘Bank Makramah’ effective Nov 27
summary: KARACHIIn a significant development Summit Bank Limited SMBL has undergone a transformation and rebranded itself as Bank Makramah Limited abbreviated as BML. This change has been officially communicated through a notice issued by the local bourse

title: Summit Bank changes name to Bank Makramah Limited
summary: We are pleased to inform you that the name of Summit Bank Limited has been changed to Bank Makramah Limited abbreviated as BML with effect from November 07 2023 said the bank in a notice to the bourse. Back in April Lootah subscribed to 3.98 billion new shares of the bank at Rs2.51 per share which translates into a subscription amount of Rs10 billion giving him a majority equity stake.

title: Bank Makramah Ltd Appoints Abdulla Nasser Abdulla Hussain Lootah As Chairman Board of Directors
summary: Bank Makramah Limited PSX BML has appointed Abdulla Nasser Abdulla Hussain Lootah as Chairman of the Board of Directors the bank informed the Pakistan Stock Exchange on Thursday. The name change followed the prior acquisition of a controlling stake in Summit Bank by prominent UAE investor Nasser Abdulla Hussain Lootah who has now become Chairman BoD at the bank.

title: Bank Makramah Limited appoints new board chair
summary: The name change came after prominent UAE investor Nasser Abdulla Hussain Lootah acquired a controlling stake in Summit Bank.
